subject: Mental Health
title: Digital Grief and Online Memorials
description: A 60-second lesson on Digital Grief and Online Memorials.

hook.text: A dead person's Facebook profile can receive birthday wishes for decades after they're gone.

buildup.text: Social media has created permanent digital memorials where the living interact with the dead.

discovery.text: Posting on deceased people's pages helps maintain continuing bonds and process grief publicly.

twist.text: But unexpected memory pop-ups and algorithmically surfaced photos can retraumatize grievers.

climax.text: Companies are now creating AI chatbots trained on the deceased's messages â€” raising ethical questions.

punchline.text: The digital afterlife is here. We're still figuring out how to grieve in it.

quiz.question: What ethical concern has digital grief raised?
options: AI chatbots trained on deceased people's messages blur life and death
Social media has eliminated all grief
